text: The Anglican Diocese of Newcastle in Australia is a diocese of the Anglican Church of Australia. The diocese is located in the state of New South Wales. It is centred in the city of Newcastle and extends along the state's coast from Woy Woy to Laurieton and inland to Merriwa and Murrurundi. The diocese was founded from the Diocese of Australia by letters patent of 25 June 1847. The cathedral church of the diocese is Christ Church Cathedral in Newcastle. The diocesan bishop is the Bishop of Newcastle. On 25 November 2017, Peter Stuart,Anglican Communion website the assistant bishop at the time, was elected as the diocesan bishop. He was installed at Christ Church Cathedral on 2 February 2018. ==Bishops== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="4" style="background-color: #7F1734; color: white;" | Bishops of Newcastle (Australia) |- ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; " | From ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; " | Until ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; " | Incumbent ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; " | Notes |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1847 | style="text-align: center;" | 1879 | William Tyrrell | |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1880 | style="text-align: center;" | 1889 | Josiah Pearson | |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1890 | style="text-align: center;" | 1905 | George Stanton | Translated from North Queensland |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text- align: center;" | 1906 | style="text-align: center;" | 1919 | Jack Stretch | Previously Dean of Ballarat and Dean of Newcastle |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1919 | style="text-align: center;" | 1928 | Reginald Stephen | Translated from Tasmania |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1928 | style="text-align: center;" | 1930 | George Long | Translated from Bathurst |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1931 | style="text-align: center;" | 1958 | De Witt Batty | Previously Dean of Brisbane |- valign="top" style="background- color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1958 | style="text-align: center;" | 1972 | James Housden | Translated from Rockhampton |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1973 | style="text-align: center;" | 1977 | Ian Shevill | Translated from North Queensland |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text- align: center;" | 1978 | style="text-align: center;" | 1992 | Alfred Holland | |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1993 | style="text-align: center;" | 2005 | Roger Herft | Translated from Waikato and Taranaki; became Archbishop of Perth in 2005. |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2005 | style="text-align: center;" | 2012 | Brian Farran | Previously an assistant bishop in the Diocese of Perth |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2013 | style="text-align: center;" | 2017 | Greg Thompson | Translated from Diocese of the Northern Territory |- valign="top" style="background-color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2018 | style="text-align: center;" | present | Peter Stuart | previously Assistant Bishop of Newcastle |} ===Assistant bishops=== Robert Davies was assistant bishop in 1963 and became Bishop of Tasmania. Leslie Stibbard was appointed an assistant bishop in 1964, serving for ten years. Geoffrey Parker served 1974–1982 and died on 28 February 1997. Richard Appleby served 1983–1992 and became diocesan Bishop of the Northern Territory. Graeme Rutherford (Graeme Stanley Rutherford) was consecrated a bishop on 4 November 2000 and served as assistant bishop for the Central Coast. Peter Stuart was assistant bishop from 2009 until his 2018 election to the diocesan See, during which time he twice administered the diocese. On 10 May 2018, Stuart consecrated Sonia Roulston and Charlie Murry as assistant bishops for the Inland and the Coast respectively. ==References== ==External links== *Diocese of Newcastle website *Churches of the Diocese of Newcastle *Anglican Diocese of Newcastle history
title: Anglican Diocese of Newcastle (Australia)
